answers.author: John Zakian
answers.text:
Kurt, I'm surprised your question has not elicited responses because it it is definitely a growing trend.  My prior experience in similar situations we started by listing the key functions of city departments, the activities and initiatives identified in the citywide goals to achieve the citywide goals, and the citywide goals themselves.  It was a very constructive effort in both capturing missing functions and/or overlapping functions in departments, and in establishing department buy-in/empowerment in becoming the lead for those activities and initiatives which fit with their functions.

author: Kurt Lockhart
text: The City of Charlottesville is creating an organizational chart to align department plans with our new citywide strategic plan. Does anyone have either examples of these kinds of organizational charts or advice on how to align department and citywide goals? Thanks in advance for your responses.
title: Aligning Department Plans with Citywide Strategic Plan
